newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico maquiladoras see 1997 exports up 14 pct.
newsitem.headline: Mexico maquiladoras see 1997 exports up 14 pct.

text.p: The Mexican maquiladora industry expects to increase exports by 14 percent in 1997, an industry spokesman told Reuters on Friday.
Mexico's maquiladora - or in-bond - plants exported $36.81 billion of goods in 1996, said Carlos Rosette, news officer for the National Maquiladora Export Industry Council.
Maquiladora plants import component parts tariff free, re-export assembled items and the manufacturer pays tax only on the value added. The goods may not be sold in Mexico.
